data.title: BR112013031371B1 - use of long-chain glycolipids as an agent with preservative properties against fungi, a method of increasing the microbial stability of a material and material comprising said long-
data.meta_description: LONG CHAIN GLYCOLIPIDES USEFUL TO PREVENT MICROBIAL DETERIORATION OR CONTAMINATION OF MATERIALS. The present invention relates to the use of, and methods of use employing certain glycolipid compounds, as defined in detail below and having preservative or antimicrobial properties, to new compounds of the glycolipid class, and to the related modalities of the invention. The compounds have the formula (I), where m is (3) to (5), n is (2) to (5), o is (0) or (1) and p is (3) to (17), with the condition that the sum m + n + o + p is not less than (14); and R is a portion of carbohydrate linked by means of one of its carbon atoms to the binding oxygen, and / or a physiological, special and pharmaceutical or nutraceutical or cosmetically acceptable salt; or an ester thereof, as such or in the form of a composition, where the compound can be present in the form of an open chain and / or in the form of a lactone.

SÃ£o tambÃ©m de importÃ¢ncia especial as contaminaÃ§Ãµes recorrentes dos cosmÃ©ticos, por exemplo, por contato das mÃ£os durante o uso normal.[0009] Deterioration events occur when microorganisms are able to overcome the product's intrinsic protective factors and develop. Also, acidophilic bacteria, such as Lactobacillus, Leuconostoc, Gluconobacter, and Zymomonas spp., And fungi, such as Penicillium, Aspergillus and Mucor spp., Can deteriorate various materials that contain water.

[00011] Outros materiais e tambÃ©m outros tipos de bebidas sÃ£o suscetÃ­veis Ã deterioraÃ§Ã£o por micro-organismos. Embora as altas temperaturas, por exemplo, 80Â°C por 20 minutos, possam reduzir as contaminaÃ§Ãµes microbianas durante o processamento, Ã© importante impedir a inativaÃ§Ã£o ou a degradaÃ§Ã£o dos conservantes na formulaÃ§Ã£o. AlÃ©m disso, o acondicionamento do produto, a solubilidade do conservante e o seu perfil de suscetibilidade antimicrobiana influenciarÃ£o a eficÃ¡cia de conservaÃ§Ã£o e, consequentemente, a vida Ãºtil dos produtos.[00012] In cosmetic products, for personal care and home care, deterioration occurs by a variety of microorganisms, ranging from Gram-positive bacteria (eg Staphylococcus spp.), Gram-negative bacteria (eg Escherichia coli, Pseudomonas spp.) To yeasts (for example, Candida albicans) and common fungi (for example, Aspergillus niger). The microbial growth in these, or on these, products depends on several intrinsic factors, such as the water activity of the formulation (the minimum water activity requirements for growth or proliferation range from 0.99 for the Acinetobacter species to 0, 61 for some fungal species), the composition of the formulation, the pH value (for example, the optimum pH for the growth of most yeasts and fungi is between 4.0 and 6.0), and the processing conditions, such as temperature. Although high temperatures, for example, 80 Â° C for 20 minutes, can reduce microbial contamination during processing, it is important to prevent inactivation or degradation of preservatives in the formulation. In addition, the packaging of the product, the solubility of the preservative and its antimicrobial susceptibility profile will influence the conservation effectiveness and, consequently, the shelf life of the products.

[00013] A proteÃ§Ã£o contra a deterioraÃ§Ã£o microbiolÃ³gica de produtos sensÃ­veis pode ser obtida usando conservantes quÃ­micos e/ou tÃ©cnicas de processamento, tais como inserÃ§Ã£o a quente, pasteurizaÃ§Ã£o por tÃºnel, temperatura ultra-alta (UHT), ou pasteurizaÃ§Ã£o seguida por acondicionamento assÃ©ptico, e/ou pasteurizaÃ§Ã£o seguida por esfriamento da bebida. Por exemplo, as tÃ©cnicas de processo, tais como o enchimento a frio, podem ser usadas para conservar uma bebida enchida a frio. As bebidas tendo um pH 2- 4,6 devem ser processadas de modo tal que os esporos sejam destruÃ­dos usando temperaturas ultra-altas, seguido por enchimento assÃ©ptico em acondicionamentos ou por utilizaÃ§Ã£o de uma retorta.[00013] Protection against microbiological deterioration of sensitive products can be achieved using chemical preservatives and / or processing techniques, such as hot insertion, tunnel pasteurization, ultra-high temperature (UHT), or pasteurization followed by aseptic packaging, and / or pasteurization followed by cooling the drink. In general, beverages with a pH <4.6 can be chemically preserved, processed hot, and placed in packaging in such a way that the product is not contaminated again. For example, process techniques, such as cold filling, can be used to store a cold filled beverage. In a similar way, this same drink can be processed using non-preserved techniques, such as hot filling, tunnel pasteurization, pasteurization followed by aseptic filling, or requiring the drink to be cooled, that is, under refrigeration, after the pasteurization stage. Drinks having a pH 2-4.6 should be processed in such a way that the spores are destroyed using ultra-high temperatures, followed by aseptic filling in packaging or using a retort.

[00014] Os sistemas de conservaÃ§Ã£o atuais para alimento ou bebidas Ã¡cidas, estÃ¡veis na prateleira, gasosas e nÃ£o gasosas, por exemplo, refrigerantes, geralmente recorrem aos conservantes de Ã¡cidos fracos (por exemplo, Ã¡cido benzoico e/ou sÃ³rbico). Os Ã¡cidos benzoico e sÃ³rbico (e seus sais) efetivamente inibem as leveduras, as bactÃ©rias e os fungos, com algumas exceÃ§Ãµes. Os Ã¡cidos fracos nas bebidas existem em equilÃ­brio entre as suas formas dissociadas e nÃ£o dissociadas, o que Ã© dependente da constante de dissociaÃ§Ã£o do Ã¡cido (pKa) e do pH da bebida. Benzoic and sorbic acids (and their salts) effectively inhibit yeasts, bacteria and fungi, with a few exceptions. Weak acids in drinks exist in balance between their dissociated and non-dissociated forms, which is dependent on the acid dissociation constant (pKa) and the pH of the drink. The pKa for benzoic acid is 4.19 and the pKa for sorbic acid is 4.76. A pH of the drink below the pKa of the acid involved pushes the balance into the undissociated form. The non-dissociated form is more effective against microorganisms; therefore, weak acid preservatives are most effective in the low pH range.

[00015] As propriedades de conservaÃ§Ã£o dos Ã¡cidos fracos podem ser aumentadas pela adiÃ§Ã£o de intensificadores dos conservantes, tais como os compostos quelantes, ao material a ser conservado, por exemplo, um alimento, uma bebida ou preparaÃ§Ã£o cosmÃ©tica. [00016] Nos produtos nÃ£o gasosos, com alto teor de nutrientes, tais como as bebidas contendo suco, vitaminas, e/ou minerais, os Ã¡cidos fracos sÃ£o mais provÃ¡veis de exercer a inibiÃ§Ã£o se usados em conjunÃ§Ã£o com os intensificadores dos conservantes. TambÃ©m os sistemas de conservaÃ§Ã£o de Ã¡cidos fracos, entretanto, tÃªm limitaÃ§Ãµes:[00016] In non-gaseous products, with high nutrient content, such as drinks containing juice, vitamins, and / or minerals, weak acids are more likely to exert inhibition if used in conjunction with preservative enhancers. However, weak acid conservation systems, however, have limitations:

[00017] A adaptaÃ§Ã£o genÃ©tica e a subsequente resistÃªncia por microorganismos Ã© uma das maiores preocupaÃ§Ãµes (ver Piper. e col., Microbiol. (2001) 147: 2635-2642). Mais frequentemente, a deterioraÃ§Ã£o de chÃ¡s, bebidas contendo sucos, e bebidas gasosas conservados Ã© devida aos micro-organismos resistentes aos conservantes.[00017] Genetic adaptation and subsequent resistance by microorganisms is a major concern (see Piper. Et al., Microbiol. (2001) 147: 2635-2642). Certain yeasts, such as Z. bailii, Z. bisporus, Candida krusei, and S. cerevisiae, have specific genes that enable them to resist weak acid preservatives and grow.

This happens despite the presence of preservatives and regardless of the presence together of EDTA or SHMP. It is also believed that some bacteria, such as Gluconobacter spp., Are resistant to preservatives. It has been shown that the levels of weak acids needed to overcome this resistance are well beyond the regulatory limits on levels of use. Most often, the deterioration of preserved teas, drinks containing juices, and fizzy drinks is due to preservative-resistant microorganisms.

Os valores mÃ­nimos de concentraÃ§Ã£o inibitÃ³ria atingem um mÃ¡ximo com um comprimento de cadeia de cerca de 8 a 12 Ã¡tomos de carbono (Varvaresou, Int. J. Cosmetic Sci (2009) 31: 163-75).[00018] Medium chain saturated fatty acids and their esters with oligohydroxylated compounds have been found to have inhibitory effects against various bacteria and fungi. The minimum inhibitory concentration values reach a maximum with a chain length of about 8 to 12 carbon atoms (Varvaresou, Int. J. Cosmetic Sci (2009) 31: 163-75).

[00019] AlÃ©m disso, as outras tÃ©cnicas de processo para as bebidas com baixo teor Ã¡cido (isto Ã©, pH > 4,6) tÃªm limitaÃ§Ãµes. Tais bebidas com baixo teor Ã¡cido devem ser tratadas termicamente, de modo suficiente para destruir os esporos das espÃ©cies Clostridium botulinum e Bacillus (B. cereus, B. subtilis e outros). Os exemplos de tais processos incluem UHT e retorta. Mesmo apÃ³s tal processamento, os produtos de bebidas devem ser manuseados em um modo para impedir a contaminaÃ§Ã£o apÃ³s o processamento. Such low acid beverages must be heat treated, sufficiently to destroy the spores of the species Clostridium botulinum and Bacillus (B. cereus, B. subtilis and others). [00020] Outros conservantes quÃ­micos podem tambÃ©m causar efeitos colaterais adversos quando consumidos. Desse modo, muitos conservantes existentes devem ser regulados e ter limites superiores legalmente fixados no uso. AlÃ©m disso, muitos conservantes, tais como o benzoato de sÃ³dio, os proprionatos, os benzenos aromÃ¡ticos, os Ã¡cidos orgÃ¢nicos, o propileno glicol e o glicerol, por exemplo, quando usados em nÃ­veis suficientes para os efeitos antimicrobianos, conferem um sabor ruim Ã bebida ou ao alimento, mascarando ou alterando atÃ© certo grau o sabor esperado pelo consumidor. Os Ã¡cidos fracos podem proporcionar uma queimaÃ§Ã£o na garganta ou na boca quando usados em altos nÃ­veis. Embora haja certas bebidas estÃ¡veis na prateleira onde esta qualidade pode ser aceitÃ¡vel, esta percepÃ§Ã£o sensorial Ã© frequentemente considerada negativa. Similarmente, os polifosfatos usados nos sistemas de conservaÃ§Ã£o de Ã¡cidos fracos podem ter algumas limitaÃ§Ãµes. Por exemplo, os polifosfatos podem conferir sabores ruins a uma bebida.[00020] Other chemical preservatives can also cause adverse side effects when consumed. Thus, many existing preservatives must be regulated and have upper limits legally set for use. In addition, many preservatives, such as sodium benzoate, propionates, aromatic benzenes, organic acids, propylene glycol and glycerol, for example, when used in sufficient levels for antimicrobial effects, give the drink a bad taste. or to the food, masking or altering to some degree the taste expected by the consumer. Similarly, polyphosphates used in weak acid conservation systems may have some limitations. For example, polyphosphates can give a drink a bad taste.

[00021] Certos solventes emolientes exibem aÃ§Ã£o sinÃ©rgica quando combinados com Ã³leos ou ingredientes essenciais contra os microorganismos, conforme observado no WO 03/034994, que Ã© incorporado por referÃªncia em sua totalidade. Os solventes emolientes usados como conservantes em cosmÃ©ticos nÃ£o produzem normalmente reaÃ§Ãµes na pele e, alÃ©m disso, tornam a pele lisa e sedosa.[00021] Certain emollient solvents exhibit synergistic action when combined with essential oils or ingredients against microorganisms, as noted in WO 03/034994, which is incorporated by reference in its entirety. Fez-se muito esforÃ§o na elucidaÃ§Ã£o da estrutura e os resultados foram apresentados em detalhe nas publicaÃ§Ãµes acima citadas; no entanto, os autores nÃ£o apresentaram quaisquer dados da atividade antimicrobiana sugerida. Depois, um dos compostos isolados por Nishida e col. (Glicenina IVA) foi descrito como agente antifÃºngico a partir de uma Dacrymyces sp. (Wunder, A., Diss. 1995, Univ. Kaiserslautern, Alemanha). Mierau (Z Naturforsch 2003; 58c: 541-6) fez referÃªncia a este trabalho.
